Parameters: String: The ID of the TV input associated with the session.
onCreateSession(java.lang.String).Description: Returns a concrete implementation of @B_android#media#tv#TvInputService#Session_E@. May return null if this TV input service fails to create a session for some reason. If TV input represents an external device connected to a hardware TV input, @B_android#media#tv#TvInputService#HardwareSession_E@ should be returned.

Parameters: String: The ID of the TV input associated with the recording session.
onCreateRecordingSession(java.lang.Strin.Description: Returns a concrete implementation of @B_android#media#tv#TvInputService#RecordingSession_E@. May return null if this TV input service fails to create a recording session for some reason.

Returns: Return an IBinder through which clients can call on to the service.
Parameters: Intent: The Intent that was used to bind to this service, as given to @B_android#content#Context#bindService_E@. Note that any extras that were included with the Intent at that point will not be seen here.
onBind(android.content.Intent).Description: Return the communication channel to the service. May return null if clients can not bind to the service. The returned @B_android#os#IBinder_E@ is usually for a complex interface that has been Note that unlike other application components, calls on to the IBinder interface returned here may not happen on the main thread of the process. More information about the main thread can be found in

ClassDesc: The TvInputService class represents a TV input or source such as HDMI or built-in tuner which provides pass-through video or broadcast TV programs. Applications will not normally use this service themselves, instead relying on the standard interaction provided by @B_android#media#tv#TvView_E@. Those implementing TV input services should normally do so by deriving from this class and providing their own session implementation based on @B_android#media#tv#TvInputService#Session_E@. All TV input services must require that clients hold the @B_android#Manifest#permission#BIND_TV_INPUT_E@ in order to interact with the service; if this permission is not specified in the manifest, the system will refuse to bind to that TV input service.
